headline: Exxon to lay off 2,000 workers worldwide as oil prices slide
summary: Exxon Mobil (XOM) is slashing 2,000 jobs across its global workforce, the latest oil giant to announce layoffs as oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) slide. Wood Mackenzie director of corporate research Neivan Boroujerdi joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss labor trends in the oil industry and what could signal more job cuts to come. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
